title: ED attaches properties worth ‚Çπ16.35 crore in BHEL housing society cheating case

title: Kerala launches comprehensive school health programme
content: A collaborative project of the Health and General Education departments, Aksharam Arogyam will screen children for various health parameters, create comprehensive health documents of every child in a school, and issue them health cards

title: Vijayapura boy wins 3 gold medals at Indo-Malaysia Yoga Championship
content: Pravan Chavan, a yoga teacher and resident of Begum Talab Tanda on the outskirts of Vijayapur city, has won three gold medals at the Indo-Malaysia Yoga Championship held in Kuala Lumpur recently

title: West Bengal Budget shows State sinking into abyss of appeasement politics under Mamata: BJP

content: The advisory from the DPH reiterates that avian influenza is a viral disease that spreads from an infected bird to other birds, and that transmission to humans is rare

content: The matter may be discussed only in the media, he said before adding that Mr. Siddaramaiah‚Äôs continuation as Chief Minister was a ‚Äòsettled issue‚Äô

title: Moolampilly Day: 41 lost lives and 18 years later, justice remains a distant dream for evictees
content: Of the 316 displaced families, 41 evictees have died without receiving the support they were promised, while the Moolampilly Package Monitoring Committee has not convened in nearly six months.

title: Railways' financial health improves in last 10 years, surplus revenue after meeting cost: Vaishnaw
content: The Union Railways Minister said the Prime Minister's decision to achieve complete electrification of the railway network has led to reduction in the energy cost besides providing immense environmental benefits.

title: Budget tourism gains traction in Kerala
content: Budget tourism initiative has generated a remarkable ‚Çπ106 crore in revenue by January 2026. In stark contrast, the State‚Äôs luxury caravan tourism, despite government subsidies aimed at boosting investment, has struggled to gain traction, with only 13 operational caravans and two caravan parks in service.

title: Kunal Kamra moves High Court against Sahyog portal, calls it assault on free speech

title: Stafford wins first MVP, says he'll return in '26
content: Rams QB Matthew Stafford edged Drake Maye in the closest MVP vote since 2003, then closed his acceptance speech by saying he'll return to play next season.

title: Brees, Fitzgerald make Hall of Fame in first year
content: The Pro Football Hall of Fame will welcome five into its 2026 class, including Drew Brees and Larry Fitzgerald -- who were in their first year of eligibility -- as well as Adam Vinatieri, Luke Kuechly and Roger Craig.

title: Garrett named DPOY; JSN wins offensive honors
content: Myles Garrett's record-breaking season earned him a unanimous selection as Defensive Player of the Year, while Jaxon Smith-Njigba narrowly won Offensive Player of the Year at Thursday's NFL Honors ceremony.

title: Doncic limps off in 1st half; MRI set on hamstring
content: Lakers star Luka Doncic limped off the court in the second quarter Thursday night against the Sixers and will undergo an MRI on his left hamstring Friday.

title: Jets DT Phillips: Glenn inherited 'cancerous' group
content: Jets DT Harrison Phillips said it has been difficult for the team to get over the franchise's losing culture, saying first-year coach Aaron Glenn inherited a "cancerous" group.

title: Dubs confident oft-injured Porzingis ready to play
content: The Warriors are unsure when the newly acquired Kristaps Porzingis will make his debut but did say the anticipation is the oft-injured big man would be back on the court soon.

title: Doc: Clase accused of rigged pitches in 48 games
content: Cleveland Guardians pitcher Emmanuel Clase is accused of throwing suspect pitches to benefit bettors in at least 48 games over two years, significantly more than was initially revealed by prosecutors, according to a court document.

title: Trump signs law that withholds U.S. WADA dues
content: A provision for the U.S. to withhold its annual dues to WADA is now law until the organization takes steps to address the country's accusations that it's beholden to Chinese influence.

content: Lindsey Vonn, Nick Goepper, Gus Kenworthy and Maddy Schaffrick are in their golden years at the 2026 Olympics. Just don't call them old.

content: Ahead of Sunday's halftime show, Bad Bunny reassured fans that his performance is meant to be felt, not translated.

content: This year marks the 10th different repeat Super Bowl matchup and the fourth in which the Patriots are involved.

content: Michael Carrick's three-game winning streak has certainly lifted the mood at Old Trafford. But building on this early form will truly test Man United's mettle.

content: Jordan Reid ranked the top 50 players in the 2026 NFL draft class, including scouting reports and standouts at every position.

title: Road to $1M paydays: How WNBA salaries evolved with each CBA
content: For the first time, a $1 million base salary is expected in the new WNBA CBA, and the cap could see a 230% increase.

title: From AD and Harden to Zubac and Vucevic: Fantasy reaction to the latest NBA trades
content: Andre Snellings and Eric Moody provide fantasy reactions as trades go down leading up to Thursday's NBA trade deadline.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Barcelona to activate Rashford clause for permanent deal
content: Barcelona have decided to sign Marcus Rashford, while Chelsea are eyeing Aston Villa's Morgan Rogers. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Delhi biker's tragic death: Kin say got no help from cops; govt suspends 3 officials - key points
content: Three Delhi Jal Board engineers were suspended after a 25-year-old motorcyclist died falling into an unbarricaded construction pit. The victim's family alleged gross carelessness by the police in their search efforts, claiming they received no timely assistance. Authorities are investigating the incident and safety protocols.

title: Moon-bound again: 4 astronauts will fly farther than anyone since 1970s
content: Four astronauts are set for a 10-day deep-space journey aboard the Artemis II mission, marking humanity's return beyond low-Earth orbit after five decades. This lunar flyby will test new spacecraft and partnerships, validating crucial systems for future lunar landings and Mars missions. The mission prioritizes crew health and scientific observation, paving the way for sustained lunar exploration.

title: K'taka CM row: DKS gets snarky after Sidda's son says no leadership change likely
content: Congress MLC Yathindra Siddaramaiah expressed confidence that his father, Chief Minister Siddaramaiah, will complete the full five-year term, citing a clear signal from the party high command. Deputy CM D.K. Shivakumar, however, responded sarcastically, suggesting the central leadership should clarify the matter. Speculation about a leadership change has intensified as the government nears its halfway mark

title: ‚ÄòIn 36 months, the cheapest place to put AI will be ‚Ä¶‚Äô: Musk makes a bold prediction
content: Elon Musk predicts space will soon host the most cost-effective AI data centers, potentially within three years. He highlighted space's superior solar energy capture, lack of atmospheric interference, and absence of day-night cycles, eliminating the need for batteries. Musk also downplayed concerns about GPU reliability in large-scale AI training, suggesting they become dependable after initial debugging.

title: Hack of the day: Use WhatsApp without sharing your phone number publicly
content: Keep your personal phone number private on WhatsApp with these smart hacks. Utilize a secondary SIM or virtual number, or leverage the WhatsApp Business app. You can even link your account to a landline for enhanced privacy and to prevent unwanted contact.

title: Watch: Sooryavanshi's animated celebration goes viral in U19 WC final
content: Fourteen-year-old Vaibhav Sooryavanshi produced a breathtaking knock in the U-19 World Cup final, smashing the second-fastest century in tournament history off just 55 balls against England. He went on to score 175, dominating the bowlers, sharing a huge partnership, and earning a standing ovation for one of the greatest U-19 innings ever.

title: 'Blew himself up': What we know about Pakistan suicide bomb blast
content: A devastating suicide bombing at a Shia mosque in Islamabad, Pakistan, claimed at least 31 lives and injured over 160 during Friday prayers. The attacker detonated himself after being stopped at the imambargah's gate. Authorities are investigating the incident, with initial reports suggesting foreign links. This attack follows recent violence in the region.

title: Google CEO thinks bloodbath in markets in reaction to Anthropic is overblown
content: Google CEO Sundar Pichai and Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang dismiss market panic over AI plugins, calling it overblown. Despite a significant selloff in software stocks triggered by Anthropic's legal AI tools, they argue AI will enhance, not replace, existing software, enabling greater productivity and innovation.

title: U19 WC final: Sooryavanshi smashes 55-ball century, puts India in command
content: Vaibhav Sooryavanshi smashed a blistering 55-ball century in the Under-19 World Cup final against England, setting a new record for most sixes in the tournament. His explosive innings, featuring eight fours and as many sixes, helped India post a strong total after winning the toss and electing to bat.

title: 'People laughed & made fun of me': 19-yr-old farmer shares how he fought odds to become model
content: Hailing from Aligarh, Nitin Kumar defied village expectations to pursue a modeling dream. Facing ridicule and financial hardship, he juggled multiple jobs, from security guard to airport worker, to fund his aspirations. Through relentless practice and social media vlogs, Nitin eventually landed his first paid shows, proving that perseverance can overcome humble beginnings and societal doubts.

title: What Amazon CEO said on 'spending plan' that wiped $250bn+ from company stock in a day
content: Amazon's stock saw a significant drop after a massive investment plan for 2026. The company plans to spend $200 billion on infrastructure. This move aims to boost Amazon Web Services' capacity for artificial intelligence. CEO Andy Jassy assured investors these investments will bring strong returns. The company is scaling up data centers and equipment to meet growing demand.

title: Prakash Raj slams Kangana Ranaut's remarks on AR Rahman
content: Prakash Raj defended AR Rahman against Kangana Ranaut's criticism, highlighting the music maestro's achievements and questioning the backlash. Ranaut had accused Rahman of being prejudiced and hateful after he refused to compose for her film 'Emergency', which she called a masterpiece. Rahman later clarified his intentions were to uplift through music.

title: Use AI for guidance, not dependency, says PM Modi at Pariksha Pe Charcha 2026
content: At Pariksha Pe Charcha 2026, Prime Minister Narendra Modi described Artificial Intelligence as a helpful tool for students but warned against overdependence. He said AI can guide learning, such as recommending biographies, but cannot replace effort or discipline. Emphasising responsible use, he urged students to combine technology with critical thinking and active study habits.

title: Stock market: Here are the top gainers and losers on NSE, BSE today - check list
content: Indian equity markets closed higher Friday, with the Sensex and Nifty gaining ground. The Reserve Bank of India maintained interest rates and proposed allowing banks to lend to REITs, a move expected to boost the real estate sector. Despite a volatile session, late buying in select stocks, particularly FMCG and private banking, drove the recovery.

title: Manipur erupts in protest after MLA Nemcha Kipgen joins NDA govt as deputy CM
content: Protests erupted in Manipur's Churachandpur after Kuki-Zo MLA Nemcha Kipgen accepted a deputy CM role, sparking backlash. The Kuki Zo Council declared a social boycott of community legislators joining the government. Burning tyres and road blockades signaled renewed unrest, with calls for a shutdown in Kuki Zo-majority areas.

title: 14-year-old Rohingya boy taunted over ‚Äòrefugee‚Äô status, stabbed to death after quarrel in Delhi
content: A 14-year-old Rohingya boy died after being stabbed multiple times in Delhi's Khajuri Khas following an argument. The victim's father reported that the altercation began when a group allegedly hurled "refugee" slurs at his son and his friends. Four teenagers have been arrested in connection with the incident.

title: Travis Kelce loses major NFL honor as retirement rumors swirl
content: Travis Kelce didn‚Äôt end up winning the Walter Payton NFL Man of the Year Award at NFL Honors, despite being the Chiefs‚Äô nominee. The honor went to Commanders linebacker Bobby Wagner, who delivered an emotional speech thanking his parents. Kelce‚Äôs loss comes at a time when retirement rumors grow, and a decision hasn‚Äôt been made by the tight end.

title: Madras High Court verdict: Vijay‚Äôs Rs 1.5cr tax penalty upheld; can appeal to tribunal
content: Madras High Court has upheld a Rs 1.5 crore income tax penalty against actor Vijay, dismissing his petition. The court found no grounds for interference, endorsing the Income Tax Department's stance on undisclosed income from the film 'Puli'. Meanwhile, Vijay's film 'Jana Nayagan' faces release delays due to censor and legal issues.

title: 'Ghee made from bathroom-cleaning chemicals': Naidu slams previous Jagan govt over Tirupati laddus
content: Andhra Pradesh chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu alleged that the previous YSRCP government used ghee adulterated with "bathroom-cleaning chemicals" in the preparation of Tirupati laddus. He claimed this practice, which allegedly lasted for nearly five years, undermined the sanctity of the Tirumala temple and also affected the Srisailam temple.

title: No more seat-sharing: Why Congress high command chose to go solo in Bengal assembly elections
content: The Congress has decided to contest the 2026 Bengal assembly polls independently, ending its decade-long alliance with the Left Front. The party will field candidates in all 294 seats, a decision influenced by the aspirations of party workers and a collective leadership consensus. This move sets the stage for a four-cornered electoral contest in the state.

title: Matthew Tkachuk, Victor Hedman clash after JJ Moser incident
content: During a tense moment in the game between the Florida Panthers and the Tampa Bay Lightning, Matthew Tkachuk got into a fight with JJ Moser. Victor Hedman then stepped in. The incident quickly made headlines in NHL news, sparking discussions about physical play, how players reacted, and sportsmanship.

title: ‚ÄòCannot force to continue pregnancy‚Äô: SC allows abortion of 30-week pregnant minor ‚Äî why it matters
content: The Supreme Court has permitted a 17-year-old to terminate her 30-week pregnancy, emphasizing a minor's right to decide against continuing a pregnancy. Justices Nagarathna and Ujjal Bhuyan directed JJ Hospital to proceed with the termination, prioritizing the girl's reproductive autonomy and her clear unwillingness to carry the pregnancy to term.

title: Malayalam actor accused of hit-and-run outside Trivandrum club; 2 bikers injured
content: A car, reportedly driven by actor Maniyanpilla Raju, allegedly struck a motorcycle and fled the scene after exiting the Trivandrum Club late Thursday. Two individuals on the two-wheeler sustained injuries and were hospitalized. The actor has reportedly pledged to cooperate with investigators and appear on Friday morning.

title: T20 World Cup: Siraj to join India T20I squad in Mumbai today; Rana all but ruled out
content: Mohammed Siraj is all set to fly to Mumbai today to link up with T20I squad before India‚Äôs World Cup opener vs USA. Harshit Rana is expected to miss out on the T20 World Cup due to a knee injury that he picked up in the warm-up match against South Africa.

title: Mercedes-Benz V-Class launch on March 3: Five things you need to know!
content: Globally, the Mercedes- Benz V-Class is offered with a 2.0-litre, four-cylinder diesel turbo engine in two configurations - 220d, with 163hp and 380Nm, and the more powerful 300d, with 237hp and 500Nm. Both engines come paired with a 9-speed automatic transmission. It‚Äôs offered with both rear-wheel drive and all-wheel drive options.

title: Skipping a big fat wedding, this couple invested in a home instead and got married there
content: An Indian couple opted to invest in a house instead of a lavish wedding, exchanging vows within their new home. This practical decision, shared on social media, has sparked widespread praise and debate about prioritizing long-term security over extravagant celebrations, resonating with many who face financial pressures.

title: Injury blow for India! Harshit Rana all but ruled out; Surya says 'he doesn‚Äôt look good'
content: India's T20 World Cup 2026 hopes for fast bowler Harshit Rana are uncertain after he sustained a knee injury during a warm-up match against South Africa. Captain Suryakumar Yadav acknowledged the situation is concerning, stating Rana hasn't been ruled out but the team is prepared to explore alternatives.  Squad balance and available bowling options will guide any replacement decisions.

title: Consensual sexual acts within marriage don‚Äôt attract Section 377: Delhi HC
content: The case started after the wife lodged a complaint claiming acts of cruelty and sexual offences after getting married to the petitioner in February 2022.

title: Noida techie death case: Allahabad HC orders immediate release of builder Abhay Kumar
content: The Allahabad High Court ordered the immediate release of Abhay Kumar, director of MZ Wiztown Planners, finding his arrest in a techie's death case illegal. The court cited the police's failure to follow mandatory arrest procedures, including informing the accused of reasons and providing a copy of the memo. Judicial remand orders were quashed.

title: No funds from the Centre? Pay teachers anyway: Supreme Court‚Äôs message to states
content: The Supreme Court has told states they cannot cite delays in central funding to underpay or withhold honorarium for RTE-linked instructors. Invoking Section 7(5) of the RTE Act, the court said the state must pay first and recover later. Uttar Pradesh has been directed to pay Rs 17,000 per month from 2017‚Äì18, begin payments from April 1, 2026, and clear arrears within six months.

title: From betrayal to second chances: How Dinesh Karthik found love again with Dipika Pallikal
content: Cricketer Dinesh Karthik faced immense personal turmoil when his childhood sweetheart and wife, Nikita, had an affair with his close friend and teammate, Murali Vijay. This devastating betrayal led to divorce and a period of depression for Karthik. However, he found love again with squash player Dipika Pallikal, rebuilding his life and career, eventually welcoming twins and retiring from cricket.

title: 'Readiness to defend against any adventurism': Ahead of US talks, Iran issues big warning
content: Iran's Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi warned of defending against US "adventurism" ahead of Oman-mediated talks. He emphasized diplomacy for national interests, stating Iran is ready to protect its sovereignty. The discussions aim to address Tehran's nuclear program, with both nations holding differing views on past events and future commitments.

title: Black hoodie, scooter and Thar: CCTV captures fatal shooting of AAP leader outside gurdwara
content: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) functionary Lucky Oberoi was fatally shot outside a Jalandhar gurdwara by a masked assailant. CCTV footage captured the masked man firing multiple shots at close range before fleeing on a scooter with an accomplice. Oberoi, a financier and property dealer, succumbed to his injuries at a hospital.

title: T20 World Cup | 'Role models don't do this' - Agha on India not touring Pak, handshake row
content: Pakistan skipper Salman Ali Agha criticised India's decision not to shake hands during the Asia Cup and for not travelling to the neighbours for the 2025 Champions Trophy. Ahead of the T20 World Cup, Pakistan's government announced a boycott of their group stage match against India, citing solidarity with Bangladesh. Agha emphasised the importance of sportsmanship for young fans.

title: Vascular surgeon recommends simple morning routine to lower blood pressure
content: A vascular surgeon highlights the critical role of the first 30 minutes after waking in combating India's silent cardiovascular epidemic. Simple morning habits like mindful breathing, hydration, gentle movement, a short walk, and a balanced breakfast can significantly support vascular health and reduce long-term heart disease risk, especially for those over 35.

title: FIR filed in Lucknow against ‚ÄòGhooskhor Pandat‚Äô director for hurting religious sentiments
content: An FIR has been filed against the director and team of the film 'Ghooskhor Pandat' in Lucknow for allegedly hurting caste sentiments and disturbing social harmony. Police stated the film's title and content appear to deliberately target a specific caste, potentially inciting animosity and public unrest. Strict legal action is promised against those found guilty of promoting enmity.

title: SSC exam schedule 2026 Havaldar, MTS, and GD Constable released: Check details here
content: The Staff Selection Commission has released the SSC exam schedule 2026, confirming dates for MTS, Havaldar and GD Constable recruitments. The MTS and Havaldar exams will begin from February 4, with self-slotting opening January 15. GD Constable tests are tentatively set from February 23. Candidates are advised to track official updates regularly.

title: 'Paid promotion': Delhi Police reacts to 'hype around surge in missing girls'
content: Delhi Police refuted claims of a surge in missing girls and children, attributing the narrative to paid promotions and warning of legal action. Official data indicates a stable trend with a marginal decline in missing-person cases over the past decade, highlighting a high recovery rate.

title: 14 New Self-Bag Drop Counters Go Live At Mumbai Airport
content: The "airport sprint" might finally be over. In a major move to eliminate terminal bottlenecks, Mumbai Airport has inaugurated 14 cutting-edge hybrid self-bag drop counters at Terminal 2.

title: Iran Shows Optimism On US Talks, Backs India Ties Ahead Of BRICS Visit
content: Iran's Ambassador to India, Dr Mohammad Fathali, said Tehran remains engaged in talks with the United States in Oman on the nuclear issue, while firmly rejecting suggestions of a broader negotiation framework.

title: Chandrababu Naidu Blames Jagan Reddy's Party For 'Chemical' Ghee In Tirupati Laddus
content: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister N Chandrababu Naidu on Friday alleged that Tirupati laddus (consecrated sweet) were made using ghee which was adulterated with "chemicals used to clean bathrooms" during the previous YSRCP government.

title: "My Father Will Remain Chief Minister For 5 Years": Siddaramaiah's Son
content: The leadership tussle has resurfaced in Karnataka, with Chief Minister Siddaramaiah's son and Congress MLC Yathindra Siddaramaiah claiming that demands for a leadership change have not been accepted by the party high command.

title: Pakistan Blast Live Updates: Suspicion Likely To Fall On Pak Taliban, Islamic State
content: At least 69 people were killed, and 169 were injured after a suicide bomber detonated himself inside a shrine in Pakistan's capital, Islamabad.

title: On Camera, Man Crushed To Death As Container Falls Off Truck In Gujarat
content: A man was crushed to death on Friday when a container fell off a truck in Gujarat's Valsad and landed on a makeshift structure where he was eating.

title: NDTV Profit Conclave To Discuss 'India: The Real Deal' With Nirmala Sitharaman, Piyush Goyal
content: As India steps into one of the most consequential chapters of its economic story, NDTV Profit will host the NDTV Profit Conclave 2026 - India: The Real Deal. The conclave is scheduled for tomorrow in New Delhi.

title: Student Assaulted, Massive Bruises On Back In Bengal Medical College Ragging
content: A ragging incident has left a first-year student with serious injuries at a government medical college in West Bengal. The incident occurred at the Purulia Government Medical College and Hospital on February 1.

title: Surat Builder Shoots Self, Then Dies Of Heart Attack On Daughter's Wedding Day
content: A noted realtor from Surat has died of a heart attack days after a suicide attempt ahead of his daughter's wedding.

title: 69 Killed, 169 Injured In Suicide Bombing At Shrine In Islamabad
content: At least 69 people were killed and many were injured after a suicide bomber detonated himself inside a shrine in Pakistan's capital, Islamabad. The explosion occurred at Tarlai Imambargah, situated in the Shehzad Town area of the city.

title: "Disgusting Behaviour": Trump Slammed For Video Of Obamas Depicted As Monkeys
content: US President Donald Trump was slammed after he posted a video on social media depicting former President Barack Obama and former First Lady Michelle Obama as apes.

title: US, Iran Holds Talks In Oman After Trump Military Threats
content: Iran and the United States were holding talks in Oman on Friday that were seen as a critical chance to avert any new escalation between the foes, after President Donald Trump threatened military action.

title: Russia, US To Start Negotiations To Renew Nuclear Treaty Soon: Kremlin
content: Russia and the United States agree that it is necessary to renew nuclear talks, the Kremlin said Friday, after the last treaty limiting Moscow's and Washington's arsenals expired.

title: New START Treaty 'Was Flawed': US Official As Key Nuclear Pact Ends
content: A senior US official on Friday criticised the last nuclear treaty between Russia and the United States for failing to include Beijing, speaking at the United Nations a day after the New START deal expired.

title: 3 Delhi Jal Board Engineers Suspended Over Biker's Death In Pool-Sized Pit
content: Three Delhi Jal Board (DJB) engineers have been suspended after a motorcyclist allegedly fell into a construction pit dug by the water agency, cabinet minister Parvesh Sahib Singh Verma said on Friday.

title: Silver Extends Losses For 2nd Day, Falls 6% To Rs 2,29,187 Per Kg
content: Silver prices extended losses for the second straight day in futures trade on Friday as investors intensified profit-booking amid a firm US dollar and easing global geopolitical tensions.

title: 'Going To Get Keys': Man Jumps To Death Moments After Rescue Attempt By Guard
content: An entrepreneur and owner of a well-known bakery died by suicide by jumping from the 17th floor of a building in Maharashtra's Solapur.

title: From BNP To Jamaat-E-Islami: Key Parties Contesting 2026 Bangladesh Elections
content: With Sheikh Hasina‚Äôs Awami League barred from contesting, the political battlefield has opened to new contenders.

title: When Time Bends For Money: Panchayat Claims Bills From The Future
content: When it comes to corruption, or alleged corruption, time is fluid - there is no future, no past, and the present is what you want it to be.

title: Darjeeling Toy Train Service Hits Record Revenue Of Rs 24.6 Crore In 2025
content: The Darjeeling Himalayan Railway (DHR) toy train service is one of the most popular tourist attractions in West Bengal.

title: 2026 Pro Football Hall of Fame: Meet the new members
content: quarterback Drew Brees is one of two quarterbacks to throw for more than 80,000 yards . wide receiver Larry Fitzgerald will also be in the 2026 Hall class . he finished second only to Hall of Famer Jerry Rice in career receptions .

title: Re-ranking the Premier League: Who's up? Who's down?
content: Oliver Glasner was named manager of the month for september . he will be followed up by Enzo Maresca, whose Chelsea won three and drew one in November . Glasner has publicly stated that he'll be leaving his club . click here for all the latest transfer news .

title: 2026 NFL Honors: Who won the league's biggest awards?
content: the best of the NFL gathered at the Palace of Fine Arts in San Francisco for Thursday's Super Bowl honors . the Seattle Seahawks and new England Patriots meet at Levi's Stadium in Santa Clara, California, for super bowl lX . quarterback Matthew Stafford won the biggest prize -- MVP .

title: Men's Power Rankings: A static top 5 (for now), but big rises (Kansas) and drops (Gonzaga, BYU) elsewhere
content: the top of the men's college basketball Power Rankings has remained pretty stagnant for weeks now . even Illinois, the newest member of the top five, is riding a 12-game winning streak and hasn't lost since Dec. 13 . before the next edition of the rankings, four of our top-five teams have road games against other top-25 teams .

title: Nine NBA trade season questions: What's next for Giannis? Did the Lakers improve?
content: the 2026 trade deadline is officially over, and a flurry of deals has shaken up both conferences with just a few months left in the regular season . the lakers were on the move this week, with James Harden heading to the Cleveland Cavaliers in exchange for darius Garland .

title: NHL Power Rankings: Updated 1-32 poll heading into Olympic break
content: snubs, injuries and countries not participating bolster debate about the tournament . the theme of this week's Power Rankings is who is the "top" player from each NHL team that isn't on an Olympic roster going to Milan . it's quite possible that Nichushkin would have also been boarding a plane overseas .
